net.sourceforge.reb4j
Class Regex

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.reb4j.Regex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CharClass
public class Regex
extends Object
implements Serializable

Represents a regular expression as defined by the Pattern class. This class serves as a wrapper around the actual String expression. It ensures that the expressions are well-formed and will not result in PatternSyntaxExceptions. It also provides facilities to construct and compose complex expressions without resorting to (manually) building them from Strings. Instances of this class are immutable and therefore thread safe. The constructor for this class is not publicly visible. Instances may only be created using the class's static methods and by the non-static methods of existing instances. This class is not intended to be extended outside this package.

Author:
Richard W. Eggert II
See Also:
CharClass, Serialized Form

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
This implementation returns true if and only if the underlying String expressions are exactly equal (equivalence is not sufficient).

This implementation returns the hash of the underlying String expression.

This implementation returns the underlying String expression that can be passed to Pattern.compile(String).

toPattern

public Pattern toPattern()
Creates a Pattern that matches the expression represented by this object. It invokes Pattern.compile(String) and returns the result.

Returns:
a compiled Pattern object.

toPattern

public Pattern toPattern(int flags)
Creates a Pattern that matches the expression represented by this object. It invokes Pattern.compile(String, int) and returns the result.

Parameters:
flags - the flags to pass to Pattern.compile(String, int).
Returns:
a compiled Pattern object.

fromPattern

public static Regex fromPattern(Pattern pattern)
Constructs an instance of Regex from the specified Pattern. This method invokes Pattern.toString() in order to obtain the underlying String expression.

Parameters:
pattern - the pattern from which to construct a Regex; must not be null.
Returns:
a Regex representing the regular expression matched by the specified Pattern.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if pattern is null.

literal

public static Regex literal(CharSequence literal)
Constructs a Regex that matches the specified literal string. All punctuation characters that have meaning to the Pattern syntax are escaped.

Parameters:
literal - the literal string to be matched by the resultant expression.
Returns:
a Regex that matches the (escaped) literal.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if literal is null.

sequence

public static Regex sequence(Regex... regexes)
Constructs a Regex composed of the specified sequence of sub-expressions.

Parameters:
regexes - the sub-expressions to compose.
Returns:
a Regex that matches the specified sub-expressions, in order.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if regexes or any of its elements is null.

then

public Regex then(Regex second)
Constructs a Regex composed of the current expression followed by the specified sub-expression. Equivalent to sequence(this, second).

Parameters:
second - the sub-expression to append to this expression in order to form the composite expression.
Returns:
a Regex that matches this expression followed by second.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if second is null.

regexes - the sub-expressions to compose
Returns:
a Regex representing the "OR" of all the specified expressions.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if regexes or any of its elements is null.

Returns:

repeat

public Regex repeat(int minTimes,
                    int maxTimes,
                    QuantifierMode mode)
Constructs a Regex that matches this Regex repeated a number of times between the specified limits. Equivalent to the regular expression phrase {minTimes, maxTimes}.

Parameters:
minTimes - the minimum number of times that this Regex must be repeated in order for the new Regex to match.
maxTimes - the maximum number of times that this Regex may be repeated for the new Regex to match.
mode - whether to use a greedy, reluctant (?), or possessive (+) quantifier.
Returns:
a Regex that matches this Regex repeated the specified number times.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if mode is null.
IllegalArgumentException - if minTimes is negative or maxTimes is less than minTimes.

repeat

public Regex repeat(int minTimes,
                    int maxTimes)
Constructs a Regex that matches this Regex repeated a number of times between the specified limits. This method is equivalent to repeat(minTimes, maxTimes, QuantifierMode.GREEDY).

Parameters:
minTimes - the minimum number of times that this Regex must be repeated in order for the new Regex to match.
maxTimes - the maximum number of times that this Regex may be repeated for the new Regex to match.
Returns:
a Regex that matches this Regex repeated the specified number times.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if minTimes is negative or maxTimes is less than minTimes.
See Also:
repeat(int, int, QuantifierMode)

repeat

public Regex repeat(int times)
Constructs a Regex that matches this Regex repeated a specified number of times. This method is equivalent to repeat(times, times, QuantifierMode.GREEDY).

Parameters:
times - the exact number of times that this Regex must be repeated in order for the new Regex to match.
Returns:
a Regex that matches this Regex repeated the specified number times.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if times is not positive.
See Also:
repeat(int, int, QuantifierMode)

Throws:

backReference

public static Regex backReference(int group)
Constructs a Regex representing a "back reference" to the specified numbered capturing group. Equivalent to the regular expression phrase \group

Parameters:
group - the number of the group to reference; must be greater than 0.
Returns:
a Regex representing the specified back reference.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if group is not greater than 0.

group

public Regex group()
Constructs a Regex representing this Regex as a capturing group. Equivalent to wrapping the expression in plain parentheses.

Returns:
a Regex representing a capturing group.

lookAhead

public Regex lookAhead(boolean positive)
Constructs a Regex representing this Regex as a non-capturing group that uses look-ahead. Equivalent to the regular expression phrase (?= (for positive look-ahead) or (?! (for negative look-ahead).

Parameters:
positive - if true, positive look-ahead is used; if false, negative look-ahead is used.
Returns:
a Regex that uses look-ahead.

lookBehind

public Regex lookBehind(boolean positive)
Constructs a Regex representing this Regex as a non-capturing group that uses look-behind. Equivalent to the regular expression phrase (?<= (for positive look-behind) or (?<! (for negative look-behind).

Parameters:
positive - if true, positive look-behind is used; if false, negative look-behind is used.
Returns:
a Regex that uses look-behind.

independent

public Regex independent()
Constructs a Regex that wraps this Regex as an independent, non-capturing group. Equivalent to the regular expression phrase (?>

Returns:
a Regex that represents an independent, non-capturing group.
